WorkExperience.title: Freelance Data Visualization Engineer/Designer
duties: Collaborated with the Lenfest Institute and INN to create data dashboard and accompanying analysis on state-level news publisher metrics
Gathered and cleaned data, developed charts and bespoke UI, and wrote copy for a story about NBA uniforms for the Pudding
Turned an illustration of the standard model of particle physics into a React-based interactive for Science News
Visualized federal funding data through charts and maps for Journalist's Resource

WorkExperience.title: WordPress Developer - Frontend (contract)
duties: Creating style guides and design systems in WordPress block themes, including theme.json and custom block work
Working with designers on visually stunning, immersive, creative UI
Planned and implemented accessibility and responsiveness improvements on legacy website frontends

WorkExperience.title: User Experience Developer II
duties: Built features for enterprise websites, using React, HTML, CSS and WordPress APIs
Designed and implemented in-CMS interfaces to improve UX for site editors
Prototyped and built static and interactive chart designs for dataviz projects, using Figma and JavaScript libraries
Improved performance and accessibility via site audits and internal component Storybook

WorkExperience.title: Frontend and Data Developer
duties: Brainstormed and developed data graphics and interactive maps to pair with university news stories, using a custom-built Svelte/D3 chart-making rig
Designed and built the university’s public-facing COVID-19 testing dashboard
Implemented style guide merging dataviz best practices with university branding standards
Developed and deployed microsites for university initiatives and collaborations
Contributed to ongoing site maintenance, using WordPress and the Timber framework

WorkExperience.title: Frontend Developer/Designer
duties: Worked with a small, remote scrum team providing agency services to nonprofit media outlets
Designed, built, and supported WordPress member websites and open-source plugins
Created UI wireframes, prototypes, style tiles and design systems for client projects
Updated internal branding guidelines and assets, for both print and digital uses

WorkExperience.title: Editorial Developer
duties: Designed and built web-native tools and data visualizations based on new and archive content
Iterated and implemented new processes to bridge design, tech and editorial desks
Built and maintained Node-based Slack chatbots, both internal- and external-facing

WorkExperience.title: Digital Media Manager (prev. Deputy Web Editor)
duties: Created Bootstrap-based WordPress themes for Kids VT, Vermont Tech Jam and Restaurant Week sites
Managed migration projects, redesigns and daily production of six email newsletters
Directed election coverage on social media, live blogs, chats and results dashboards
Contributed multimedia elements, charts and blog posts to editorial products

Talks.title: First SvelteKit Data App
Talks.content: I’m leading a hands-on session to teach data journalists how to use SvelteKit to create interactive, data-driven apps.

Talks.title: Building a Culture of Accessibility and UX in Your Organization
Talks.content: I facilitated a group discussion of two dozen news website editors on the common obstacles they face in getting user-centered, accessible experiences to be highly prioritized in under-resourced newsrooms.

Talks.title: Boosting careers without the ladder
Talks.content: I co-facilitated a working session on how early- and mid-career journalists could advance their careers in organizations where the traditional career growth path doesn’t value tech skills.

Talks.title: A Data Analysis of My Drinking Habits
Talks.content: I gave a lightning talk about what I learned by loading my data from the beer-rating app Untappd into RStudio for a graduate-level statistics course.

Talks.title: Advancing with Visual Analytics: Key (Free) Programs to Dissect Your Data
Talks.content: I presented a crash-course to a professional workshop on free software to manage and analyze data, including Plotly, Infogram, and DocumentCloud.

Talks.title: Responsive Design and Dataviz
Talks.content: For a meetup of frontend professionals, I presented examples of web-based data visualizations that tackled desktop-to-mobile screen-size differences in creative ways, both from my own work and the wider realm of visual data journalism.

Talks.title: Big Ambition, Small Staff: How the F*** Do I Prioritize?
Talks.content: I co-facilitated a session to journalism technology professionals and students on how to efficiently, ambitiously do the work in newsrooms when your tech team is small (or only you).

VolunteerPositions.content: Met weekly with early-career data visualization professionals, advising them on both the technical side (D3 tutorials) and the business side (job-seeking advice) of the dataviz industry.

I helped to start up the independent supporters’ group for the new women’s professional soccer team coming to Boston in 2026. I designed the group’s inaugural logo and branding package and advised directors on the website build.

As a member of the Board of Directors of the original independent supporters’ group for New England’s MLS team, I led an accessible, modern redesign and rebuild of the group website, in addition to designing the supporters’ scarf for the 2025 season and helping to organize social events.
